com.sap.dirigible.repository.api

Interface ICollection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IEntity
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBCollection

    public interface ICollection
extends IEntity
    The ICollection interface represents a collection in the repository.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ICollection createCollection(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new collection with the specified name in this collection.
      IResource createResource(java.lang.String name, byte[] content, boolean isBinary, java.lang.String contentType)
      Create resource under this collection by specifying the binary flag
      java.util.List<IEntity> getChildren()
      List the children of this collection
      ICollection getCollection(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the collection with the specified name contained in this collection.
      java.util.List<ICollection> getCollections()
      Returns a list of all the child collections held by this collection.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCollectionsNames()
      Returns a list containing the names of all the child collections directly contained within this collection.
      IResource getResource(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the resource with the specified name contained in this collection.
      java.util.List<IResource> getResources()
      Returns a list of all the resources held by this collection.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getResourcesNames()
      Returns a list containing the names of all the resources directly contained in this collection.
      void removeCollection(ICollection collection)
      Removes the child collection represented by the parameter.
      void removeCollection(java.lang.String name)
      Removes the collection with the specified name contained in this collection.
      void removeResource(IResource resource)
      Removes the child resource represented by the parameter.
      void removeResource(java.lang.String name)
      Removes the resource with the specified name from this collection.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.sap.dirigible.repository.api.IEntity

        copyTo, create, delete, exists, getInformation, getName, getParent, getPath, getRepository, isEmpty, moveTo, renameTo

    • Method Detail

      • getCollections

        java.util.List<ICollection> getCollections()
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a list of all the child collections held by this collection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getCollectionsNames

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCollectionsNames()
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a list containing the names of all the child collections directly contained within this collection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createCollection

        ICollection createCollection(java.lang.String name)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new collection with the specified name in this collection.

        The name should not contain any slashes.

        The change is persisted to the backend.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getCollection

        ICollection getCollection(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the collection with the specified name contained in this collection.

        The returned collection is just a representation. It may not exist on the backend.

        Returns:
        an ICollection instance.

      • removeCollection

        void removeCollection(java.lang.String name)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Removes the collection with the specified name contained in this collection.

        The name should not contain any slashes.

        The change is persisted to the backend.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • removeCollection

        void removeCollection(ICollection collection)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Removes the child collection represented by the parameter.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getResource

        IResource getResource(java.lang.String name)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the resource with the specified name contained in this collection.

        The returned resource is just a representation. It may not exist on the backend.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • removeResource

        void removeResource(java.lang.String name)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Removes the resource with the specified name from this collection.

        Changes are persisted to the backend.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • removeResource

        void removeResource(IResource resource)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Removes the child resource represented by the parameter.

        Changes are persisted to the backend.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
